item.title: States with symmetry
item.description: How do you think of quantum states? I like to think of their order of symmetry. It is a very hard job to characterize the order of symmetry of quantum states in general; but there’s a special subclass of quantum states that exhibit very clear symmetry. They are called bosonic states. A brief introduction An order-$N$ state is a $+1$ eigenstate of the discrete rotation operator $\hat{R}_N$, \[ \hat{R}_N = \exp(i\dfrac{2\pi}{N}\hat{n}), \] where $\hat{n}=\hat{a}^\dagger\hat{a}$.
